ffnn module¶

Created on Mon Jun 8 10:26:57 2020

@author: befrenz

ffnn.backward_activation(dA, cache, lambd, regularizer, activation)[source]¶
Example:
>>> np.random.seed(2)
>>> dA = np.random.randn(1,2)
>>> A = np.random.randn(3,2)
>>> W = np.random.randn(1,3)
>>> b = np.random.randn(1,1)
>>> Z = np.random.randn(1,2)
>>> sum_cache = (A, W, b)
>>> activation_cache = Z
>>> cache = (sum_cache, activation_cache)

>>> dA_prev, dW, db = backward_activation(dA, cache, lambd = 0 ,regularizer = None, activation = "relu")
>>> print("With Relu")
>>> print ("dA_prev = "+ str(dA_prev))
>>> print ("dW = " + str(dW))
>>> print ("db = " + str(db))

>>> dA_prev, dW, db = backward_activation(dA, cache, lambd = 0 ,regularizer = None, activation = "softmax")
>>> print("
With Softmax”)
>>> print ("dA_prev = "+ str(dA_prev))
>>> print ("dW = " + str(dW))
>>> print ("db = " + str(db))
Output:

With Relu dA_prev = [[ 0.44090989 -0. ]

[ 0.37883606 -0. ] [-0.2298228 0. ]]

dW = [[ 0.44513824 0.37371418 -0.10478989]] db = [[-0.20837892]]

With Softmax dA_prev = [[ 0.44090989 0.05952761]

[ 0.37883606 0.05114697] [-0.2298228 -0.03102857]]

dW = [[ 0.39899183 0.3973954 -0.06975568]] db = [[-0.23651234]]

ffnn.backward_dropout(dA_prev_temp, D, keep_prob)[source]¶
ffnn.backward_grad(dZ, cache, lambd, regularizer)[source]¶
Example:
>>> np.random.seed(1)
>>> dZ = np.random.randn(3,4)
>>> A = np.random.randn(5,4)
>>> W = np.random.randn(3,5)
>>> b = np.random.randn(3,1)
>>> cache = (A, W, b)

>>> dA_prev, dW, db = backward_grad(dZ, cache, lambd=0, regularizer=None)
>>> print("Without L2 Regularization")
>>> print ("dA_prev = "+ str(dA_prev))
>>> print ("dW = " + str(dW))
>>> print ("db = " + str(db))

>>> l2_dA_prev, l2_dW, l2_db = backward_grad(dZ, cache, lambd = 0.9, regularizer = 'l2')
>>> print("
With L2 Regularization”)
>>> print ("dA_prev = "+ str(l2_dA_prev))
>>> print ("dW = " + str(l2_dW))
>>> print ("db = " + str(l2_db))
Output:

Without L2 Regularization dA_prev = [[-1.15171336 0.06718465 -0.3204696 2.09812712]

[ 0.60345879 -3.72508701 5.81700741 -3.84326836] [-0.4319552 -1.30987417 1.72354705 0.05070578] [-0.38981415 0.60811244 -1.25938424 1.47191593] [-2.52214926 2.67882552 -0.67947465 1.48119548]]

dW = [[ 0.07313866 -0.0976715 -0.87585828 0.73763362 0.00785716]

[ 0.85508818 0.37530413 -0.59912655 0.71278189 -0.58931808] [ 0.97913304 -0.24376494 -0.08839671 0.55151192 -0.10290907]]

db = [[-0.14713786]

[-0.11313155] [-0.13209101]]

With L2 Regularization dA_prev = [[-1.15171336 0.06718465 -0.3204696 2.09812712]

[ 0.60345879 -3.72508701 5.81700741 -3.84326836] [-0.4319552 -1.30987417 1.72354705 0.05070578] [-0.38981415 0.60811244 -1.25938424 1.47191593] [-2.52214926 2.67882552 -0.67947465 1.48119548]]

dW = [[-0.0814752 -0.28784277 -1.02688866 0.73478408 -0.24353767]

[ 0.90783172 0.74875962 -0.43216662 0.6696189 -0.78903459] [ 0.81102242 0.13703735 -0.07696496 0.4081879 -0.05995309]]

db = [[-0.14713786]

[-0.11313155] [-0.13209101]]

ffnn.backward_prop(AL, Y, caches, dropout_masks=[], keep_probs=[], lambd=0, regularizer=None)[source]¶

Example

>>> np.random.seed(3)
>>> AL = np.random.randn(1, 2)
>>> Y = np.array([[1, 0]])

>>> A1 = np.random.randn(4,2)
>>> W1 = np.random.randn(3,4)
>>> b1 = np.random.randn(3,1)
>>> Z1 = np.random.randn(3,2)
>>> cache_activation_1 = ((A1, W1, b1), Z1)

>>> A2 = np.random.randn(3,2)
>>> W2 = np.random.randn(1,3)
>>> b2 = np.random.randn(1,1)
>>> Z2 = np.random.randn(1,2)
>>> cache_activation_2 = ((A2, W2, b2), Z2)

>>> caches = (cache_activation_1, cache_activation_2)

>>> grads = backward_prop(AL, Y, caches)
>>> for key,value in grads.items():
...     print(str(key)+" : "+str(value))
Output:
dA1[[-0.80745758 -0.44693186]

[ 0.88640102 0.49062745] [-0.10403132 -0.05758186]]

dW2 : [[ 0.50767257 -0.42243102 -1.15550109]] db2 : [[0.61256916]] dA0 : [[ 0. 0.53064147]

[ 0. -0.3319644 ] [ 0. -0.32565192] [ 0. -0.75222096]]

dW1[[0.41642713 0.07927654 0.14011329 0.10664197]

[0. 0. 0. 0. ] [0.05365169 0.01021384 0.01805193 0.01373955]]

db1[[-0.22346593]

[ 0. ] [-0.02879093]]

ffnn.evaluate(X, Y, parameters)[source]¶

Example

>>> np.random.seed(1)
>>> X = np.random.randn(3,2)
>>> Y = np.array([[1, 0, 0],[0,1,1]]).reshape(3,2)
>>> W1 = np.random.randn(5,3)
>>> b1 = np.random.randn(5,1)
>>> W2 = np.random.randn(3,5)
>>> b2 = np.random.randn(3,1)
>>> parameters = {"W1": W1,
...               "b1": b1,
...               "W2": W2,
...               "b2": b2}
>>> acc, loss = evaluate(X, Y, parameters)
>>> print("acc = %f | cost = %f"%(acc,loss))
Output:

acc = 0.500000 | cost = 0.769464

ffnn.forward_activation(A_prev, W, b, activation)[source]¶

Example

>>> np.random.seed(1)
>>> A_prev = np.random.randn(3,2)
>>> W = np.random.randn(1,3)
>>> b = np.random.randn(1,1)

>>> A,c = forward_activation(A_prev,W,b,activation = 'relu')
>>> print("A with Relu = " + str(A))

>>> A,c = forward_activation(A_prev,W,b,activation = 'softmax')
>>> print("A with Softmax = " + str(A))
Output:

A with Relu = [[3.26295337 0. ]] A with Softmax = [[1. 1.]]

ffnn.forward_dropout(A, keep_probs)[source]¶
ffnn.forward_prop(X, parameters, keep_probs=[], regularizer=None)[source]¶
Example:
>>> np.random.seed(1)
>>> X = np.random.randn(3,2)
>>> W1 = np.random.randn(3,3)
>>> b1 = np.random.randn(3,1)
>>> W2 = np.random.randn(2,3)
>>> b2 = np.random.randn(2,1)
>>> parameters = {"W1": W1,
                  "b1": b1,
                  "W2": W2,
                  "b2": b2}
>>> AL, caches, _ = forward_prop(X, parameters)
>>> print("AL without dropout = " + str(AL))

>>> AL, caches, _ = forward_prop(X, parameters,keep_probs = [0.9], regularizer = "dropout")
>>> print("

AL with dropout = ” + str(AL))

>>> print("

Length of caches list = ” + str(len(caches)))

Output:
AL without dropout = [[0.25442549 0.64096177]

[0.74557451 0.35903823]]

AL with dropout = [[0.20251119 0.61487938]

[0.79748881 0.38512062]]

Length of caches list = 2

ffnn.forward_sum(A_prev, W, b)[source]¶

Example

>>> np.random.seed(1)
>>> A = np.random.randn(3,2)
>>> W = np.random.randn(1,3)
>>> b = np.random.randn(1,1)
>>> Z, c = forward_sum(A,W,b)
>>> print("Z = "+ str(Z))
Output:

Z = [[ 3.26295337 -1.23429987]]

getget.

ffnn.init_layers(X, Y, hidden_layers)[source]¶

Initializes the layers of networks with the numberof nodes in each layers.

Parameters

mnjnj. –

Returns

knlknl.

Example

Here, shape of x = (784,m)

shape of y = (10,m)

>>> layers_dim = init_layers(x, y, hidden_layers = [32,16])
>>> print(layers_dim)
Outputs:

[784, 32, 16, 10]

ffnn.init_parameters(layers_dim, initialization='random')[source]¶

Initializes the parameters (W,b) for each layer.

Parameters

kngnjgjg. –

Returns

nkngkg.

Example

Here, layers_dim = [784, 32, 16, 10] >>> parameters = init_parameters(layers_dim, initialization = “random”) >>> print(“Layer Weight Bias”) >>> print(“================================”) >>> for l in range(1,len(layers_dim)): … print(str(l) +” ” + str(parameters[‘W’+str(l)].shape) +” “+ str(parameters[‘b’+str(l)].shape))

Outputs:

1 (32, 784) (32, 1) 2 (16, 32) (16, 1) 3 (10, 16) (10, 1)

ffnn.initialize_adam(parameters)[source]¶
ffnn.predict(X, parameters, second_guess=False)[source]¶
ffnn.softmax_cross_entropy_cost(AL, Y, caches, lambd=0, regularizer=None)[source]¶

Example

>>> AL = np.array([[4.21200131e-01, 1.55876995e-04],
               [6.91917292e-02, 1.18118501e-05],
               [5.09608140e-01, 9.99832311e-01]])
>>> cost = softmax_cross_entropy_cost(AL, Y, caches)
>>> print("Cost without l2 = " + str(cost))

>>> cost = softmax_cross_entropy_cost(AL, Y, caches, lambd = 0.7, regularizer = 'l2')
>>> print("Cost with l2 = " + str(cost))
Output:

Cost without l2 = 0.6742809046007259 Cost with l2 = 8.875542970361

ffnn.train(X_train, Y_train, X_dev, Y_dev, layers_dim, hyperParams, initialization='random', optimizer='bgd', regularizer=None, verbose=3)[source]¶
ffnn.update_parameters(parameters, grads, learning_rate, optimizer='bgd', beta1=0, beta2=0, epsilon=0, v={}, s={}, t=0)[source]¶

Example

>>> np.random.seed(2)
>>> W1 = np.random.randn(3,4)
>>> b1 = np.random.randn(3,1)
>>> W2 = np.random.randn(1,3)
>>> b2 = np.random.randn(1,1)
>>> parameters = {"W1": W1,
              "b1": b1,
              "W2": W2,
              "b2": b2}
>>> np.random.seed(3)
>>> dW1 = np.random.randn(3,4)
>>> db1 = np.random.randn(3,1)
>>> dW2 = np.random.randn(1,3)
>>> db2 = np.random.randn(1,1)
>>> grads = {"dW1": dW1,
         "db1": db1,
         "dW2": dW2,
         "db2": db2}

>>> parameters,_,_ = update_parameters(parameters, grads, 0.1)

>>> print ("W1 = "+ str(parameters["W1"]))
>>> print ("b1 = "+ str(parameters["b1"]))
>>> print ("W2 = "+ str(parameters["W2"]))
>>> print ("b2 = "+ str(parameters["b2"]))
Output:
W1 = [[-0.59562069 -0.09991781 -2.14584584 1.82662008]

[-1.76569676 -0.80627147 0.51115557 -1.18258802] [-1.0535704 -0.86128581 0.68284052 2.20374577]]

b1 = [[-0.04659241]

[-1.28888275] [ 0.53405496]]

W2 = [[-0.55569196 0.0354055 1.32964895]] b2 = [[-0.84610769]]
